subjective.chief_complaint: Loss of smell post COVID, effort limitation, mucoid expectoration
subjective.hpi: 48-year-old male jeweler with a history of occasional smoking and asthma presents with loss of smell following COVID-19 infection. He reports feeling effort-limited since the infection and has mucoid expectoration. He notes positive triggers for symptoms and possible GERD (GER+/-). He has previously benefited from Foracort and intranasal corticosteroids (INCS). No known drug allergies. No significant family history.
subjective.patient_history: Asthma, Occasional smoking history, Post-COVID status

physical_exam.text_raw: O/E: Chest - clear. SpO2 98%. No any drug allergy. No family history.

objective.labs_imaging: Pending: CBC, IgE, S. Mg, Vit D3, B12 levels, Complete PFT (spirometry, DLco, transfer factor)

metadata.ocr_quality_check: Good legibility. Text is fragmented but clear.
critical_ambiguities: GER +/- status ambiguous (could mean GERD present or ruled out)
Conflict between 'N. known comorbs' and 'h/o asthma' (likely implies no other comorbidities)
